intro: Hieracium peponomorphum, commonly known as the melon-hedgerow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It features serrated leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium peponomorphum is often considered a weed but plays a role in supporting pollinators and soil stabilization.
